title: Houston-Tulane Preview Capsule
text:
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE No. 24 Houston (5-0, 2-0 AAC) at Tulane (2-3, 1-1), 9 p.m. (ESPNU)
Line: Houston by 19.
Series Record: Houston leads 14-5.
WHAT'S AT STAKE
After entering the AP Top 25 poll this week for the first time this season, Houston aims to continue its climb in the rankings while remaining a front-runner in the American Athletic Conference. Despite some ugly early season losses, Tulane could still establish itself as a factor in the AAC with an upset.
KEY MATCHUP
Tulane's aggressive four-man defensive line, which has helped the Green Wave record 39 tackles for losses, against Houston dual-threat QB, Greg Ward Jr. Ward is the only player nationally to average over 200 yards passing per game (260.4) and over 100 yards rushing per game (110.8).
PLAYERS TO WATCH
HOUSTON: Ward leads the American and is sixth nationally with an average of 371.2 yards of total offense.
TULANE: Linebacker Nico Marley has been in on a team-leading leads Tulane in tackles with 36, 29 solo.
FACTS & FIGURES
Houston is ranked for the first time since 2011. ... First-year Houston coach Tom Herman, who was only the second coach in program history to win his first three games, is also one of only two new coaches in college football who remain unbeaten this season, along with Florida's Jim McElwain. Both coaches lead their teams into south Louisiana football venues about 80 miles apart this week, as No. 8 Florida plays at No. 6 LSU on Saturday night. ... Three of Houston's victories have come by 21 or more points. ... Junior linebacker Steven Taylor leads the nation in tackles for loss (2.4 per game) and is second in sacks (1.6 per game). ... Tulane's Devin Powell starts at quarterback for Tanner Lee, who is out with concussion symptoms. ... Tulane has forced 12 turnovers through its first four games, which ranks second in the American and 20th nationally. ... The Green Wave's last win against a ranked team was in 1984 at No. 19 Vanderbilt. Since then, the Green Wave is 0-38 against the Top 25.
___
